Short answer: He was rushed by events. He wasn’t entirely ready for war and
had no plans of starting his war that year, although he was getting close.
Mainly, he was concerned because Gandalf had …
[image: Quora]
<https://www.quora.com/qemail/track_click?aoid&aoty=7&aty=4&cp=0&ct=1754506544491570&et=130&id=f3bb3ffa0e664040aeb5498fa3505b9f&inject=1&source&src=1&st=1754506544494350&stories=1_qOBnJlZSrU1%7C1_IHhBjenUNMi%7C1_sdAXmqY5M7%7C1_bZCOAVSW8pQ%7C1_VNzsdoVzdyF%7C1_bk08xIEGLAP%7C1_a2c5pznzK2H%7C1_1LbXK8HQYWx%7C1_9IirjrH7LSx%7C1_XyYVkIxOYb4&ty&ty_data&uid=X6ACY70K4Dh&v=0>

from the Third Age:

2759: ...Saruman takes up his abode in Isengard....

2851: The White Council meet...

side, only Gandalf would seriously stand a chance against Sauron if Gandalf
took the Ring and made...

I assume that you mean, between fleeing from Dol Guldur and attacking
Gondor in the Third Age. He had to assemble a construction crew and rebuild
the Dark Tower first. Foll...

<https://www.quora.com/qemail/track_click?al_imp=eyJ0eXBlIjogMzMsICJoYXNoIjogIjB8NHwxfDI3MTk0NDMyNSJ9&al_pri=0&aoid=bZCOAVSW8pQ&aoty=1&aty=4&cp=4&ct=1754506544491570&et=130&id=f3bb3ffa0e664040aeb5498fa3505b9f&inject=1&source=7&src=1&st=1754506544494350&stories=1_qOBnJlZSrU1%7C1_IHhBjenUNMi%7C1_sdAXmqY5M7%7C1_bZCOAVSW8pQ%7C1_VNzsdoVzdyF%7C1_bk08xIEGLAP%7C1_a2c5pznzK2H%7C1_1LbXK8HQYWx%7C1_9IirjrH7LSx%7C1_XyYVkIxOYb4&ty=1&ty_data=bZCOAVSW8pQ&uid=X6ACY70K4Dh&v=0>

Updated October 12, 2021
